de.kerner.commons.exec
Class AbstractProcessRunner

java.lang.Object
  de.kerner.commons.exec.AbstractProcessRunner
All Implemented Interfaces:
ProcessRunner
public abstract class AbstractProcessRunner
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProcessRunner

Simple implementation of ProcessRunner.

Example: 

 final AbstractProcessRunner r = new AbstractProcessRunner(new File("/")) {
        public List<String> getCommandList() {
                return new CommandStringBuilder("ls").addFlagCommand("-lh").build();
        }
 };
 int exitCode = r.createAndRun();
This AbstractProcessRunner will execute ls -lh on the unix root directory. Exit code of command will be stored in exitCode.

Author:
Alexander Kerner
See Also:
AbstractProgrammRunner

Constructor Detail

AbstractProcessRunner

public AbstractProcessRunner(java.io.File workingDir)

Constructs a new AbstractProcessRunnner. Process working directory is set to workingDir. workingDir may be null -- this means to use the working directory of the current Java process, usually the directory named by the system property user.dir, as the working directory of the child process.

Parameters:
workingDir - process' working directory
See Also:
ProcessBuilder.directory(File)

Description copied from interface: ProcessRunner

Creates and executes the process. stdout and stderr are redirected to out and err.

Specified by:

Parameters:
